top grim_menu_core_help_event

NV/GR

grim_menu_core_help_event, event

This option allows you extract a brightness profile at the selected location for each plane in the image. The left button selects a single point, and the right button selects a region to average over.

Parameters

event

Author information

History:

Written by: Spitale, 7/2016

Statistics

Lines:
5 lines
Cyclomatic complexity:
1
Modified cyclomatic complexity:
1

top grim_menu_image_profile_help_event

NV/GR

grim_menu_image_profile_help_event, event

This option allows you extract a brightness profile in an arbitrary direction in the image. The left button selects the region's length and then width; the right button selects a region with a width of one-pixel.

Parameters

event

Author information

History:

Written by: Spitale, 6/2005

Statistics

Lines:
5 lines

top grim_menu_ring_box_profile_radial_help_event

NV/GR

grim_menu_ring_box_profile_radial_help_event, event

This option allows you create a radial brightness profile from a rectangular image region. 1) Activate the ring from which you wish to extract the profile. 2) Select this option and use the mouse to outline a ring sector:

top grim_menu_ring_profile_radial_help_event

NV/GR

grim_menu_ring_profile_radial_help_event, event

This option allows you create a radial brightness profile. 1) Activate the ring from which you wish to extract the profile. 2) Select this option and use the mouse to outline a ring sector: Left Button: the sector is bounded by lines of constant longitude.', $ Middle Button: the sector is selected in an arbitrary direction. Left Button: the sector is bounded by lines perpendicular to the projected longitudinal direction.

Parameters

event

Author information

History:

Written by: Spitale, 5/2003

Statistics

Lines:
5 lines
Cyclomatic complexity:
1
Modified cyclomatic complexity:
1

top grim_menu_pointing_manual_help_event

NV/GR

grim_menu_pointing_manual_help_event, event

This option allows you to change the pointing manually using pg_drag. 1) Activate the points that you wish to drag. 2) Select this option and use the left button to translate your points, the middle button to rotate them, and the right button to accept the change and correct the pointing.

Parameters

event

Author information

History:

Written by: Spitale, 7/2002

Statistics

Lines:
5 lines
Cyclomatic complexity:
1
Modified cyclomatic complexity:
1

top grim_menu_pointing_farfit_help_event

NV/GR

grim_menu_pointing_farfit_help_event, event

This option produces a rough pointing correction by comparing the active points with edges detected in the image using pg_edges and pg_farfit. 1) Activate the edges that you wish to correlate. 2) Select this option. Only active limbs, terminators, and ring edges are used.

Parameters

event

Author information

History:

Written by: Spitale, 7/2002

Statistics

Lines:
5 lines
Cyclomatic complexity:
1
Modified cyclomatic complexity:
1

top grim_menu_pointing_lsq_help_event

NV/GR

grim_menu_pointing_lsq_help_event, event

Opens a gr_lsqtool widget. Using the current data, camera, active planet, and active ring descriptors. See gr_lsqtool.pro for details.

Parameters

event

top grim_menu_mosaic_help_event

NV/GR

grim_menu_mosaic_help_event, event

Uses pg_mosaic to combine all visible image planes into a mosaic. The new mosiac is opened in a new grim instance.
